trans-unit.source: Authenticate your app with Active Directory Authentication Library Single Sign-On (iOS) | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Authenticate your app with Active Directory Authentication Library Single Sign-On (iOS) | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to authentication users for single sign-on with ADAL in your iOS application.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to authentication users for single sign-on with ADAL in your iOS application.

trans-unit.source: Authenticate your app with Active Directory Authentication Library Single Sign-On
trans-unit.target: Authenticate your app with Active Directory Authentication Library Single Sign-On

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you add authentication to the quickstart project using the Active Directory Authentication Library.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you add authentication to the quickstart project using the Active Directory Authentication Library.

trans-unit.source: To be able to authenticate users, you must register your application with the Azure Active Directory (AAD).
trans-unit.target: To be able to authenticate users, you must register your application with the Azure Active Directory (AAD).

trans-unit.source: This is done in two steps.
trans-unit.target: This is done in two steps.

trans-unit.source: First, you must register your mobile service and expose permissions on it.
trans-unit.target: First, you must register your mobile service and expose permissions on it.

trans-unit.source: Second, you must register your iOS app and grant it access to those permissions
trans-unit.target: Second, you must register your iOS app and grant it access to those permissions

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] This tutorial is intended to help you better understand how Mobile Services enables you to do single sign-on Azure Active Directory authentication for iOS apps.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] This tutorial is intended to help you better understand how Mobile Services enables you to do single sign-on Azure Active Directory authentication for iOS apps.

trans-unit.source: If this is your first experience with Mobile Services, complete the tutorial [Get started with Mobile Services].
trans-unit.target: If this is your first experience with Mobile Services, complete the tutorial [Get started with Mobile Services].

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: This tutorial requires the following:
trans-unit.target: This tutorial requires the following:

trans-unit.source: XCode 4.5 and iOS 6.0 (or later versions)
trans-unit.target: XCode 4.5 and iOS 6.0 (or later versions)

trans-unit.source: Completion of the [Get started with Mobile Services] or [Get Started with Data] tutorial.
trans-unit.target: Completion of the [Get started with Mobile Services] or [Get Started with Data] tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Azure Mobile Services SDK
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Azure Mobile Services SDK

trans-unit.source: The [Active Directory Authentication Library for iOS]
trans-unit.target: The [Active Directory Authentication Library for iOS]

trans-unit.source: Configure the mobile service to require authentication
trans-unit.target: Configure the mobile service to require authentication

trans-unit.source: Add authentication code to the client app
trans-unit.target: Add authentication code to the client app

trans-unit.source: Download the [Active Directory Authentication Library for iOS] and include it in your project.
trans-unit.target: Download the [Active Directory Authentication Library for iOS] and include it in your project.

trans-unit.source: Be sure to also add the storyboards from the ADAL source.
trans-unit.target: Be sure to also add the storyboards from the ADAL source.

trans-unit.source: In the QSTodoListViewController, include ADAL with the following:
trans-unit.target: In the QSTodoListViewController, include ADAL with the following:

trans-unit.source: Then add the following method:
trans-unit.target: Then add the following method:

trans-unit.source: In the code for the `loginAndGetData` method above, replace **INSERT-AUTHORITY-HERE** with the name of the tenant in which you provisioned your application, the format should be https://login.windows.net/tenant-name.onmicrosoft.com.
trans-unit.target: In the code for the `loginAndGetData` method above, replace **INSERT-AUTHORITY-HERE** with the name of the tenant in which you provisioned your application, the format should be https://login.windows.net/tenant-name.onmicrosoft.com.

trans-unit.source: This value can be copied out of the Domain tab in your Azure Active Directory in the [Azure Management Portal].
trans-unit.target: This value can be copied out of the Domain tab in your Azure Active Directory in the [Azure Management Portal].

trans-unit.source: In the code for the `loginAndGetData` method above, replace **INSERT-RESOURCE-URI-HERE** with the **App ID URI** for your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: In the code for the `loginAndGetData` method above, replace **INSERT-RESOURCE-URI-HERE** with the **App ID URI** for your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: If you followed the [How to Register with the Azure Active Directory] topic your App ID URI should be similar to https://todolist.azure-mobile.net/login/aad.
trans-unit.target: If you followed the [How to Register with the Azure Active Directory] topic your App ID URI should be similar to https://todolist.azure-mobile.net/login/aad.

trans-unit.source: In the code for the `loginAndGetData` method above, replace **INSERT-CLIENT-ID-HERE** with the client ID you copied from the native client application.
trans-unit.target: In the code for the `loginAndGetData` method above, replace **INSERT-CLIENT-ID-HERE** with the client ID you copied from the native client application.

trans-unit.source: In the code for the `loginAndGetData` method above, replace **INSERT-REDIRECT-URI-HERE** with the /login/done endpoint for your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: In the code for the `loginAndGetData` method above, replace **INSERT-REDIRECT-URI-HERE** with the /login/done endpoint for your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: This should be similar to https://todolist.azure-mobile.net/login/done.
trans-unit.target: This should be similar to https://todolist.azure-mobile.net/login/done.

trans-unit.source: In the QSTodoListViewController, modify `ViewDidLoad` by replacing `[self refresh]` with the following:
trans-unit.target: In the QSTodoListViewController, modify `ViewDidLoad` by replacing `[self refresh]` with the following:

trans-unit.source: Test the client using authentication
trans-unit.target: Test the client using authentication

trans-unit.source: From the Product menu, click Run to start the app
trans-unit.target: From the Product menu, click Run to start the app

trans-unit.source: You will receive a prompt to login against your Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: You will receive a prompt to login against your Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: The app authenticates and returns the todo items.
trans-unit.target: The app authenticates and returns the todo items.

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
